We will discuss arguments concerning probability in Chapter 11.



Causal Reasoning
Statistical generalization can tell us thatall ravens are black and thatmost Texans
will vote for McCain, but these generalizations alone cannot tell us what makes
ravens  black  or  what  makesmost  Texans  vote  for  McCain.  To  determine  what
causes such phenomena, we need to engage in a new kind of inductive reasoning—
causal reasoning—which is the topic of this chapter.
